Reviews.Title: “service was lacking, room was clean though”
Reviews.Author: DepartingDuo
Reviews.Content: Stayed because it was close to conference. Location is super (walking distance to restaurants, staples center, movie theater, etc.) but service was terrible. Arrived in our room to find the door open and maintenance technician working on the mini bar. He offered that he would be done in a few minutes and barked into his walkie talkie at someone about how "guests are in the room". We awkwardly sat down on the bed and watched him take the fridge apart for a few minutes. We suggested we switch rooms. He agreed it was probably a good idea and complained to us about the front desk clerk. Apparently complaining about his coworkers to the customer made good business sense to him. It was important to him that we understand that he didn't make a mistake--it was the front desk clerk. We returned to the lobby with all of our luggage. They switched our room to a different floor. When we opened that door we were hit with strong odor of cigar smoke. It was so strong that we looked out the window to see if we were above the smoking area. No butt hut under us so we called front desk and asked if we had been put into a smoking room. They said no and offered to move us again. This time they sent someone to the room with keys so we wouldn't have to truck down the small elevator with all of our bags. The third room was better--clean, no odors or maintenance techs. We wondered what type of inconvenience would qualify us for a free upgrade to a suite, but figured that since they didn't offer, maybe it was better to stick with the current room. The next morning I went to the lobby for the free coffee advertised in the room binder. At 6:30 a.m. there was no coffee. At 7:45 a.m. there was no coffee. I phoned the front desk at 8:00 and asked if they still offered free coffee as advertised. She said "Oh yes, it'll be here at 9 today." Why bother? Also disturbing was the "danish" mentioned in the binder--bagged pastries that should have been in a vending machine. (Come on, even twinkies would have gotten a better review from me.) The next morning I asked the front desk for help printing out some tickets for an event. They said the concierge would be in at 10 a.m. I stopped to meet her at around 10:30. I explained that I needed access to a printer when I made the purchase. She looked confused and asked me to email her whatever I needed printed. I explained that I needed to print my receipt when I made the purchase in order to attend the event. She said, "Well I don't know how I could help you with that. I have this laptop that isn't connected to a printer. I can only print something that you would email to me." I said "Forget it, we will find another location where we can print." We had originally planned to stay for 5 nights but left after 3 nights. This was the earliest I could adjust our plans to a different hotel due to the conference schedule. No one asked us if we enjoyed our stay upon checkout and I did not offer how disappointed we were with all levels of service. I would not stay here again. We wondered how they stay in business and decided that they must be relying on single night stays due to events at Staples center.

Reviews.Title: “above average room in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Ruei
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed in the luxe for a few nights as i was attending a conference in downtown LA. on the plus sides, the location is really convenient (walking) to downtown LA, the staples center, and the (chain) restaurants nearby. even though you can walk to these places, other than staples center and the restaurants nearby like the espn zone, trader vics, etc, i probably wouldn't walk around at night. the hotel room was really nice. pretty large with a king-sized bed and modern updated bathroom. the bathroom didn't have a tub, but the shower was great, with both a handheld and overhead downpour style. overall the bathroom was pretty small, but stylish. the amenities in the room were above average. good wireless connection, flat-screen tv, keurig coffee machine. however your options are either to have a little more street noise and face figueroa, or face a parking lot in the back. the restaurant on the second floor is in construction, so there's no food or bar options right now, but you're right across the street from many many selections. i think once the renovations take place, the rating could go up to a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Nice....but”
Reviews.Author: TiffanieH
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, interesting what can be done to a former Holiday Inn. Great location for restaurants and LA Live Activities. Staff was pleasant and helpful. The reason for 3 stars is that the hotel is doing a bit of construction to the front and it starts with all the noise and commotion at exactly 7am every day...to make matters worse, on Friday morning at 7am, we had labor protesters marching and chanting with loudspeakers over some wage dispute with the hotel. It was very loud even from the 7th floor. Fortunately we were finally able to get the noisy A/c unit to mostly drown out the protesters. I would recommend anyone staying there to request a room not on the LA Live center side, until the construction is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Property”
Reviews.Author: gotech1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luxe for a week attending a show at the LA Convention Center. The hotel room was modern and bed amazingly comfortable. Staff went over and above, very friendly. Only downside is the restaurant and bar and under construction so there are no services. There are several restaurants across the street, my favorite being the Farm...great take out. Gym is also under construction but they have comp admission to a local Gold's Gym.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe was great”
Reviews.Author: MarkinMontreal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in April for 3 nights. No complaints, very nice room on the back of the hotel. King size bed was great and the bathroom all stone, marble and glass. Location was great if you are taking in an event at the LA Live area as the hotel is across the street from it. Unfortunately it doesn't have a business center or a restaurant. Would not hesitate to stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe City in heart of LOB city”
Reviews.Author: warhorse82
Reviews.Content: Other than the fact they don't have a business center to print off Laker tix from Stubhub the LA Live view room was a very nice room. If any hotel has a better location for events I'd like to know where it is. Enjoyed a Laker game, ESPN Zone, and the stroll across the street to the hotel, it doesn't get any more convienient than that..Noticed the effort that LA has put in to security around the event area greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, modern look.”
Reviews.Author: ElSteveLumo
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here whilst we were in LA in 2009 - staffs were nice. Rooms were impeccable; beds were great, better than mine at home! The only thing about the bathroom was the bathtub drain kept clogging up, other than that it was a very enjoyable stay. The Crème Brule via room service was AMAZING! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe City Center Hotel”
Reviews.Author: okayrenee
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome Hotel.If you are going to the Staple Center or anything in that area of Pico and Figueroa and you are looking for a great place to stay, this is the spot. The Luxe Staff was outstanding and very helpful, I had the Superior King suite where the bed just cradled me. The shower is awesome really wakes you up, everything was super clean. I can`t wait til they are finished with their restaurant I can tell it`s going to be outstanding. So once again if you are going to be visiting this area this is the Hotel to stay at and the price was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: jciupa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here February 20th, 2012 for 1 night while going to a Kings game. The location of this hotel is perfect. Right across the street from LA Live. I have a view of the ESPN Zone, Ritz Carlton, and a ton of restaraunts. The hotel was clean, quiet, and a great place to stay. Nice stand up shower with the shower head coming out of the roof, which is perfect because I am 6'4''. Will definately be coming back to the Luxe next time I am in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location.”
Reviews.Author: jamieandkurt
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who has plans at the Staples Center or Nokia Theater. The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean, and there was plenty of entertainment and dining options within walking distance. They provide robes, slippers, and wonderful toiletries! The shower was beautiful but the head was not working properly and we requested a non smoking room but there weren't any available. The smell of stinky cigarettes really disgusted me but if they had a non smoking room available I honestly would not have any complaints. I recommend taking a car to and from the airport. I would stay at this hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: zbidwell
Reviews.Content: Location - The location is outstanding. It is located just across the street from the Staples Center / Nokia Theater / LA Live Area and easily within walking distance of most of the downtown area. The hotel also has convenient access (through a 10 min drive) to the USC Campus (visiting campus was the purpose of my stay). Room - Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a suite (king bed in one room + living room / kitchenette in another room) which wasn't expected. The suite was spacious in the bedroom and living room. The bathroom was a bit on the smaller side, but didn't bother too much. Rooms in the suite were all extremely clean and put together. Service - We stayed at the hotel for only two nights, but all hotel employees that we encountered were extremely friendly and accommodating. We did not ask for housekeeping during the day after our first night since we arrived late and were in the hotel during the day. Housekeeping noticed and called the room to make sure that we did not need service and asked if we needed clean towels - a gesture not seen at many comparable hotels. Amenities - Parking ($25 per night - self-park or valet) was readily available immediately next to the hotel for convenient access. The lot is spacious and there were plenty of spots. The main downside of this hotel was lack of a couple amenities. I believe that they are doing some type of renovation, so the closure should be temporary. The fitness center was closed and the onsite laundry was temporarily unavailable for repairs. Also, they are building / renovating something on the outside of the hotel, but I'm not sure what that was. The Luxe does not have a pool which is a downside if looking for some relaxation in busy downtown. In the end, I would definitely consider staying at Luxe City Center next time I am in the area. The stay was great. If with family or wanting a pool, I might consider elsewhere that actually has a pool though.

Reviews.Title: “Getting better and better”
Reviews.Author: rockstar89
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on multiple visits to Staples Center and gets better every time. Still a little noisy due to thin walls, but newly designed rooms are holding up well and the lobby looking fancier every time I visit. Will continue to be my stop downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms good location for Staples Center, service could be better”
Reviews.Author: Pheephox
Reviews.Content: Rooms decent, with amenities which you would expect from a hotel of this standard, but what is it with hotels with electronic fridges which don't allow you to store medicine etc (or anything of your own) and then this hotel will bring you a massive fridge but charge you $20 a day for it which just feels wrong somehow. Front desk and reservation staff need really to have some training in customer service and actually being civil and polite and not treating guests like they are idiots, however the staff with "lowlier" jobs bellmen, man who brought me fridge etc were super helpful! maybe they should train the front desk, so nice hotel but disappointing service really

Reviews.Title: “Location location...”
Reviews.Author: weeeo
Reviews.Content: In South Park near Staples Center and other tourist attractions. Great service, nice rooms and very reasonably priced. Even saw P Diddy and his entourage in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “More than excellent service! Rooms and hotel were nice and an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sophiasalinas
Reviews.Content: The best part was the service. Employees were helpful. Even when I called to complain about my noisy neighbor, they handled it RIGHT AWAY. The rooms were pretty nice. I would go there again. Only complaint was the price for daily parking. $25 seemed like a lot when u can get $5 all day parking right down the street. I loved the security measures- made me feel safe and secure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful chic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mickole
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luxe for an avent at the Staples Center. The Luxe was literally next door and in the heart of downtown LA. The Luxe was absolutely amazing. We got there about 12 and check in wasn't until 3. That was no problem. Jessica at the front desk checked us right in. We stayed in a King room. The room itself was gorgeous. Comfortable b large king sized bed, spacious room, light, simple decor, and awesome light out drapes. There was construction going on the outside and on the stairwell, but not bothersome in the least. Id defiantly stay again if I were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Staycation”
Reviews.Author: lalalopez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed 1 day because we were there for a concert at Nokia Theater. We are locals, but didnt want to have to drive home after concert. The room was very nice and modern, no complaints there. Unfortunately it is "under construction" so nothing was available (no bar, no restaurant, no fitness room and maybe no spa-not sure about that one). Luckily that area is bustling with restaurants and bars (although we were out on the Sunday of President's Day weekend and everything was closed by midnight when concert was over.) This hotel has potential, but not quite there yet :(

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed it - we will be back”
Reviews.Author: hbriverrat1
Reviews.Content: We live locally but from time to time we like to take a little mini vaca to downtown LA to enjoy a concert, some delicious downtown eats and spend the night to complete the experience. So we have stayed in our fair amount of rooms in the area over the years. This one was a very pleasant surprise. Think boutique hotel. it is only 8-9 floors so you are not lost in a mega hotel and service is great since the place isn't the size of a small city. This place has gone through some major renovations. I heard it used to be a holiday inn although all remnants of that are gone. It is clean, nicely styled, and a pleasure to stay at. We upgraded to an executive suite and were very glad we did. It was spacious, tastefully decorated and had a comfortable city apartment vibe instead of your standard hotel room experience. The bed was very comfortable and the rain shower was a very nice touch. As for convenience to the area, you can't beat this especially if you are going to an event at Staples Center as we were. It is just across the street as is the Grammy Museum and LA Live. It is also right next to El Cholo restaurant (behind it) which is a LA staple that has been there since 1923 and down the street from the Pantry, another LA staple. The pantry for breakfast and El Cholo for dinner is a great day. This hotel does not have a restaurant yet so that means no room service either at the moment. The girl at the front desk said April it would be done. We were a little bummed but it ended up having zero effect on our visit when we took count of the countless amazing places within walking distance. Another huge bonus for the smokers and the initial reason I found and booked this hotel. They have smoking rooms available upon request! This is a fairly big deal as a lot of hotels have gone to a smoke free policy. A smoking option is good for both smokers and non smokers alike. I have found that when smoking rooms are not available that there is always a little group that are forced to go right outside the lobby doors since they can't in their room. Inconvenient for us and not pleasant for those that dont smoke. We will be back for our next mini vaca!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expections”
Reviews.Author: WMC2800
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly from the desk to housekeeping. Technology in room is superior to most. Internet conccection was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Luxe”
Reviews.Author: pschiffer
Reviews.Content: Property is going through a renovation, so there is construction in most of the common areas, but the rooms have all been nicely renovated. Restaurant and Fittness areas are not open, but they do offer a free day pass to the local Gold's Gym four blocks from the property. Impressed so far. I would like to return again and see all the progress.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: I don't often have a stay like this - I can always find something wrong with a hotel since I used to travel extensively for business. However, this hotel was nearly perfect on every level - a pleasant surprise. Stayed here to attend a concert at the Staples Center - got a great rate. If you are planning to attend an event at Staples or Nokia, this property is perfect for you. You are literally right across the street from the venues and LA Live, so it is so easy and convenient. Aside from the location, this property is excellent. It is being renovated and the rooms are spacious, comfortable and well appointed. I love the sleek, modern look and feel of the place and it is very comfortable. Great service - everyone hotel staff member we interacted with was warm and friendly, willing to help. Parking, while a bit pricey, is convenient and secure. It's hard to find any faults with this property - clean, modern, comfortable, great staff, good bed, excellent bathroom and tv. They are currently working on the lounge and restaurant, which should be open soon. That will make this property even better since you can hang out, have a few drinks and then dine at LA Live or other great restaurants in the downtown area or stay and dine there. We'll definitely be coming back to this excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good uptown location, bad beds”
Reviews.Author: W-Site
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation for Parent's Weekend at USC in August, for a hotel stay the end of October, 2011. When we arrived, our confirmed king room reservation was unavailable, as they had booked a convention in the meantime, and the king rooms were all taken. We were given a room with 2 double beds despite showing our printed confirmation dated almost 3 months previously for a king room. The front desk clerk was totally unapologetic and literally shrugged us off in an uncaring manner. Our room was facing a parking lot, where there was live music until the wee hours of the morning....very noisy, despite the very loud AC unit under the window. The bed had a very deep "sink-hole" in the middle, and needed a new mattress desperately. All in all, I would have expected a lot more from having read previous reviews. The only pluses were the in-room coffee maker, which was a Keurig with a very nice selection of teas/coffees, and even hot cocoa pods available in the lobby, as well as the rainmaker shower head and very nice shower. It is right across the street from the Staples Center, though, so the location is convenient. Also across the street was a restaurant called "The Farm" which served awesome blueberry pancakes! However, a bad night's sleep tends to negate all those pluses. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe City Center - Is Deluxe”
Reviews.Author: MrBadua
Reviews.Content: Drove in from home in San Diego, CA. Great stay at the Luxe City Center Hotel on S. Figueroa St. in Los Angeles. Perfect across the street location for LA Live and Grammy Museum. We had a large, clean king suite. Very pleasant experience. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kfarwell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luxe City Center for my Birthday weekend, and it was awesome. From the moment I walked inside to check in until the moment I left the service was great. Its a very nice hotel, I had friends to come by before we went out on the town, and it wasn't a problem. It actually rained the weekend of my birthday, and they provided me with an umbrella which saved me! Someone is at the desk 24/7 and that is a plus for me. I loved the look, the location, cleanliness, and the customer service. I had a great time and would recommend the Luxe City Center any day.

Reviews.Title: “Staples Center Concert Stay”
Reviews.Author: sheblee72
Reviews.Content: I was attending the Jay Z concert and stayed at this location & boy was it good decision I made. This location was right across the streeet from the venue with great staff & comfort! The only thing I didnt care for was that I was charged as a guest for parking of $30, now thats alot. Any how this place was great & very close to the venue! I felt at home with a comfortable robe, slipper, bed, coffee, great big screen & a wonderful staff to assist with any and everything! I will be back for sure & spreading the world of this gold mines for a great price also I must add!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tim F
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive the staff is very attentive and friendly. The rooms are very nicely done; if you get a west facing room the view is outstanding. The hotel is across the street from LA Live, Staples Center, and one block from "The Original Pantry" restaurant. They are remodeling, but the hotel is still very clean. Will definitely stay here again and I am looking forward to trying their restaurant once it opens. Until then the Keurig machine in the room makes a nice cup in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: dvsdeedee
Reviews.Content: Very nicely appointed room. You can't beat this location for taking in an event at the Nokia or the Staples Center.

Reviews.Title: “My 48 Hour stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Justmythoughts1965
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew to LA from Chicago for a business meeting. We arrived completely exhausted, and was greeted as we pulled up in our rental car. The young man was so friendly, and made it clear that he was here to help. The people at the front desk were equally as friendly and helpful with any, and all, questions. Our room was clean and up to date in style. We had a mini bar which was much too expensive, but fully stocked with a wide variety of drinks and munchies. In a pinch, it would have been convenient since the the Luxe did not have a restaurant available at the time. They did have an awesome coffee maker, where you could make yourself a single cup of coffee or tea. We were also provided with 2 bottles of water daily, and mints in the evening. The very best part was how comfy the bed was (we slept great!), complete with plenty of pillows, and a shower that was made for tall people--which we are. Our bathroom was stocked with a spare tooth brush, shaver, body wash, sewing kit, slippers and thick robes. The Luxe was located within an easy walking distance of The Staples Center and many restaurants. While we were there they had live music and we even heard a few of last season's American Idols perform. The only complaint would be that the walls were too thin, easily allowing in the noise from the rooms next to you. The rates were reasonable, and I believe that you would be very happy with a room at The Luxe.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to rest your head, but no destination hotel”
Reviews.Author: uscchic
Reviews.Content: It's a fine place to sleep for the night, but no place to spend a week. Clean room. NO ROOM SERVICE...REALLY??? They did give us bottled water on check-in. Parking is a little pricey at $30/day. Toiletries are okay. Pretty loud...thin walls...and they came knocking on our door several times for mini-bar service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: EdwardsNana
Reviews.Content: The LUXE was like a home away from home. Really, we were treated like family. Starting with Tony at the door in the lobby to Jessica N. at the desk. Our rooms were clean and well stocked. Each morning there was coffee and a assortment of danish pastries in the lobby besides the coffee we enjoyed in our room, and in the evening fresh apples. Our beds were turned down in the evening and bottled water and mints at the bedside. I am a grandmother of eight and came to check off something on my bucket list. I attended my first movie premier. It was "Twilight Breaking Dawn." The LUXE smoothed out any bumps we felt from the people in charge at the Nokia. The thrill of seeing my first celeb's in my lifetime, was even more of a treat when it happened to be the gracious Robert Pattinson, Kristen Stewart, Peter Facinelli and Stephenie Meyer. We havn't had class like this in Hollywood for a long time. Not since the great Jimmy Stewart. The LUXE is a wonderful place to stay. "Trust Me"

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessGiggles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first time as part of a group, so we didn't choose it, but we will for sure be back! For the service, the location and the rooms, it was great. They are still remodeling the restaurant/bar, so we were not able to try that, but there were so many other options just out the door, it wasn't a glaring problem. Our room did have a distinct smokey smell, especially for a non smoking room, that was a bugger. The only other issue we had was that we asked for an accessible room and were changed from the originally booked one, into an accessible one at check in, but it wasn't accessible. We managed as i knew they were sold out, but next time, we will make sure. And like i said, there will absolutely be a next time!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 2 Nights...Wished it were more!”
Reviews.Author: LovinItCA
Reviews.Content: Room: A+ - Was amazing. Newly renovated with super comfy bed, very chic furniture, comfortable sitting chair, nice energy saving features (that were also very friendly to use), great HD TV, free internet (wireless), and they even had evening turn-down service with chocolates, bottled waters, comfy foam slippers. The room was modern, sophisticated, very user friendly with plugs everywhere for my computer and cell phone, and a very relaxing place to be. Bathroom: A- - Rain shower head!!! with option to switch to hand-held. Previously water pressure was discussed as low - I did not have this problem. The water pressure was perfect. The sink was ultra-modern design and nice to look at but kind of got water everywhere, so not the best functionality. I gave bathroom an A minus because it also lost points for the bathroom products. The body wash and shampoo just kind of seemed watered down; the way the rest of the bathroom looks, I expected better presentation and quality of the bath products. Lobby: D+ - undergoing renovations as previously stated. I only needed it to check-in and meet my colleagues, but the smell of paint was pretty strong. I am sure it will get better once finished, but for right now, it's a mess and not very welcoming. Check-In: C - I'm being nitpicky here, but especially with a not pretty lobby they should want to move people through. I had to wait about 10 minutes to be helped...and I was 2nd in line. There were another 4 people behind me. Finally, the agent at the desk asked for help and 3 other agents started checking people in. For a de"Luxe" hotel (I had to sneak at least one of those in my review), I would expect that help should not have to be asked for - people should be monitoring that. And if nobody is monitoring, then the agent should be more proactive about asking for help before a long line forms. Location: A - right across the street from Nokia Theatre and Staples Center, easy walk to all downtown locations. The subway is a 5-10 minute walk (depending on how fast or slow you go). I had taken Amtrak to Union Station and it was a $15 cab ride to the hotel. I took the subway back and it was a faster ride (if you exclude walk to subway) and only $1.50. OVERALL: B+ - Overall, the experience is almost an A, mostly because of the most important part of a hotel for me, which is the room itself. And the room at the Luxe is incredible. They did it right, in my opinion, with the upgrade to what used to be a Holiday Inn. They did the rooms first and are doing the rest later. I hate it when a hotel has a beautiful lobby but the rooms are old and dingy - it almost feels like false advertising. But at the Luxe, they took care of the guest first and are redoing the rest now. I do wish the place had a pool. But overall, despite being an SPG and Marriott Rewards member, when I stay downtown LA again, it will be at the Luxe.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed two nights at the Luxe”
Reviews.Author: Sue F
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a completely pristine room, this is the place to stay. The bed was so comfortable and they had about five pillows on the bedding. I am not one that can easily sleep in a hotel, but I had less problems with that in this room. The room was emaculate. The downside was I was not expecting the fact that they did not have room service within the hotel. That really was a deal breaker for me and unless they add that, I probably would not go there. BUT, in their hotel greeting book, it stated that the room service was coming soon. The hotel was fairly quiet also. It was an absolute ideal location and the cost was reasonable for where it was located. I was covering an event as a media person for one of their sporting events and it was perfect. It also felt safe walking around in this area, they have a lot of security at this arena that is across the street from the Staples Center, which is where I was covering that sporting event. I would highly recommend this hotel, if you do not mind not having room service. Also, I got the most economical room and there was NOT a bathtub---only a high-tech shower, which worked out fine---but if that is important make sure you get a room that has a bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Undergoing Renovation”
Reviews.Author: DaveyCee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel whilst attending a conference in the LA Convention Center, located within walking distance. The hotel is right in the downtown area, making it ideal for the Staples center, the Nokia center or downtown shopping. There is on-site parking too - I noticed plenty of spaces even when the hotel was full, so I doubt it will be a problem for you. The room was large, well equipped and clean. There is a shower, but no bath, which is a little disappointing for a hotel of this price. Free wifi access was available across the entire hotel. My biggest complaint is that the hotel is currently undergoing some serious renovation work to the common areas. As such, a number of the features which attracted me to the hotel were not available, including the fitness centre. I notice that these are still being advertised on the hotel web site - a rather cheap trick, in my opinion. It's a nice enough hotel, in a good location, with excellent staff. It's just a shame they have chosen to behave in this manner.

Reviews.Title: “Fine business place”
Reviews.Author: Gustavb
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was fine, hotel is in a good location near the convention center, close to some nice restaurants, although distant from the metro heading to the centre (15min walk). rooms were quiet, the bed was great, internet was free. when i stayed it was under re-construction so we had to eat elsewhere and didn't stay much at the hotel then, but the overall experience was good. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel still under construction - 4a union picketing & no apology from mgt”
Reviews.Author: drivin_n_cryin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is still under construction and the photos on the website don't show that part. There is really no lobby, just a couple chairs, there is no bar, no restaurant, no business center and no pool. There was a union protest at 4a just outside the hotel. The protesters used bull horns, noise makers, and did their best to wake the guests up. The hotel did not apologize, did not provide a discount, and did even offer ear plugs. The room was clean, the bathroom is very nice and has nice amenities including extra's like bathrobes and slippers. I had a safe and a minibar. My colleagues did not have a minibar. That's good and bad because they make you sign a statement that you will have to pay about $50 restocking if you put anything of your own in the mini bar. There was no room service menu. The only chair to sit on was the desk chair. The stylish brown chair and ottoman in the photos was not in room. The internet was very slow and I could not send larger files via email to my colleagues. Location is very good. Elevators are slow and there are only 2 of them. There is one at the back of the hotel that goes to the garage - however an employee told me I was not supposed to be using it because it was for employees. There was frequently a backup at the front desk as people tried to check in, check out, get new keys, etc.. and there were not enough clerks to help so we had to wait quite a bit. The employees were nice and polite at the front desk given how many people they had to serve.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: jcostel3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here when we went to a concert at the Nokia Theater. The hotel was right across the street from the theater as well as Staples Center. It was a great location because we could walk! The only thing we didn't really like about it was that right when we got in something went wrong with check in and they couldn't check us into a room. We waited about 15 minutes until a manager could get us into another room. Once we finally got up to the room there was a worker just sitting in the room doing nothing. I just looked at her and said "hi...this is our room" she said ohhh ok I was just uhhh filling up your refrigerator". Yea right! Not a big deal though, she got right out and that was that. We had a great nights sleep and a great night at the concert!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located to the major attractions downtown”
Reviews.Author: rosamum
Reviews.Content: Was in walking distance to many big restaurants, clubs, bars, and the Staples Center. Rooms were modern, luxurious, and comfortable for my short one night stay. There was a charge for valet parking but the service is fast! For the location, it is a big plus and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms and Convienant Location”
Reviews.Author: Metalheadrr3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb to see the Grammy's. Located across the street from the Staples center. Beautiful rooms with luxurious bathroom and big screen TVs. Was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Lilmissmalcolm
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Los Angeles area before, but have never stayed in the heart of the city before. The Luxe City Center had freshly remodeled rooms, and was just across the street from LA Live. LA Live is full of restaurants and night clubs. The staff was incredible they gave us bottled water upon check in and they always had snacks out. One member of the staff even helped us find a chauffeur to take us to Hollywood one night. For the night the chauffeur for only $100 (far less than the cab ride would have been.) The same car took us to LAX for $50. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a place to stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best.”
Reviews.Author: Doopsx3
Reviews.Content: Interior of room was nice however I did not like the Kobe Bryant picture (I do not believe it was appropriate and should not have been in the room). Walls are thin with no sound deadening. Tenants next door had a dog that whined all the time. Bathroom was nice other than the one ply toilet rough toilet paper. Restaurant and bar were closed due to refurbishment. I had to park on the second level outside which to me I should not have paid the same price as tenants that got the inside covered premium parking. Wireless Internet connection was weak and spotty. Beds had a pillow top mattress but no boxed springs which meant I had to deal with a sore lower back each morning. The beds offered no support. Great location but in need of work. This hotel is not quite ready for the public. They need to complete renovations and workout the bugs. Customer service was good.

Reviews.Title: “great location and fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: fannybaws
Reviews.Content: Although the bar area and pool were close due to renovations at the hotel I was upgraded to a great room. Large tv, excellant shower and massive very comfortable bed. Hotel was 15 minutes drive from lax and located opposite the staples centre within easy walking distance of the metro and a good selection of bars and restarants. No issues with noise from traffic or the renovations.Parking was $25 a day which seemed steep at the time but considering the location in downtown LA was to be expected. Staff were friendly and welcoming and i'd definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “City Center Luxe Hotel is the place to be!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marilynn1
Reviews.Content: First trip to L.A. for a Lakers game. Came over from Vegas and wanted to spend the night. I knew nothing about the place and was tired of looking at hotels around the area. I booked online a king superior. We checked in and was upgraded to an Executive suite. Wow!! What an upgrade!. It was spacious and didn't have your typical doors to separate the areas. To me it had a contemporary asian flair with the sliders. The shower was fantastic and I actually used their shower gel and lotion (love, love, love). I want more of it. I also hit the pillow and thought I must have this pillow on my bed at home. It's from Pacific Coast so I have a call in to their housekeeping to get the exact particulars. There was construction going on, but unless you were outside, you didn't know it. I had bought a parking pass for the game, but didn't have to use it. Parking was $25 but it's L.A or a metropolis so get used to it. New York parking is atrocious so it was a steal. Staff was kind and helpful. We were in a new time share in Vegas and we said City Center Luxe tops the time share except there wasn't a 120 inch tv screen. I like the idea that it's not a cookie cutter hotel and the location to everything in the center of the city. Love, love, love. Go and book!!!! Marilynn and Ron.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice decor”
Reviews.Author: riverboatrandy
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the great location across the street from LA Live and the Staples Center. We also enjoyed walking down to Santee alley and taking in the downtown LA feel. The room was very new and a lot of fun. Only drawbacks were the restaurant and bar were not open as of this date and parking was a bit high.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL ROOM,AFFORDABLE, AND EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Renaylo
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I booked this hotel not knowing anything but the reviews that I have read on Trip Advisor which were mixed. We attended the Lady Gaga Concert. We were going to stay at the Marriott,but the rates were very high for one nite stay. We chose this hotel because of the rates and the location next to the Staples Center. This hotel does not look "chic or fancy" in the lobby or elevator, but the rooms are gorgeous. Comfortable beds, nice bathroom, all new showers,decor. Very very nice! When we left, I noticed the next day that my wedding ring was gone. I was sure I left it there as I had taken it off to wear something else to the concert. Long story short, the manager, John Kelly,went over and above ANY customer service I have ever had in my whole life! He searched the room inside and out and called me back several times to try to console me and showed so much compassion on what I was going through. Eventually, I found the ring and called him back to let him know. He was so genuine in his concern for everything. This kind of customer service is so rare, and even if I hadn't found my ring, I still would have had positive thoughts for this hotel. I def will stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Started out positive.. Wait until renovations are complete”
Reviews.Author: SuburbanMiss
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my stay at the Luxe City Center. I stayed a few nights at JW and decided to try the Luxe for our last nite. Positives: Check-in was quick and easy, Front desk staff/Bellman were nice. Room is BEAUTIFUL & clean. The room is modern, updated and similar design to the JW. Rain showerhead was great. The also gave free slippers and free bottles of water in your room. The location cant be beat. Directly across from LA live/Staples. FREE WI-Fi. I initially thought this was a great decision. Negative: We were NOT told of renovations. After we were checked in and handed the room key. We are on the elevator w/ the bellman and he says "Did the front desk mention we're in the process of renovating?" Uh... No. He then proceeds to tell us there is no pool, restaurant, fitness center, business center, room service.... For 175/nt we get "0" amenities?? So.... we get back late one night and decide we want a coke...No vending machines in the entire hotel. Front desk suggested we go 5 blks to the supermarket. Then around midnight i call down and ask if they happen to have any type of antacid as i didnt have any & boyfriend cant sleep. Again... No. But you can go to the supermarket...At this point we're just trying to make the best of a bad stay..then the kicker..Wake up Sat morning and need to arrange shuttle pickup. Contact downstairs and they give me a bellman who says its less than the 4hr min. reservation period so he cant schedule and he gives me the number to the shuttle directly. I contact the shuttle a few times and no answer. So i contact the bellman again and explain im getting no answer. He states that he'll try to schedule anyway and takes my info. and will call back. He calls back 10 mins later saying that he tried to call them but they are not answering.... Hello i just told him that ... so i ask about a taxi and he says okay ill get some #s and call you back.. He calls back about 15 mins later and states that even if i get a taxi/shuttle they cant get in b/c they have locked down the hotel b/c there is a labor protest outside?? What?? I tell him that i have been communicating w/ him all morning about shuttle/taxi service to the airport and he finally decides to tell me that the hotel is on lockdown?? There was NO notice to guests. How do we get to the airport? So he says he will call a taxi driver that they regularly use and he will open the gate to let him in to pick us up but we have to leave NOW. The driver will be there in 15 mins. So we rush to get dressed/ packed/ready and downstairs to checkout leave in 15 mins. Once we get downstairs the entire front glass of the hotel is covered w/ gates. We cant see out. The 'driver' drives into the back of the hotel to pick us up ( I feel like we are in rush hour..) The bellman opens the gate for us to get out.. We get to the airport where the driver charges us MORE than the amount the bellman quoted but at this point we're just happy to get outta there. I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Move on”
Reviews.Author: Lm53
Reviews.Content: Dont be fooled by the new renovations. The rooms look nice but the walls are paper thin with no sound proofing. I could hear the guy next door brushing his teeth. I also heard him with the friend he must have picked up at a bar. Even the tv couldn't drown out the noise. The staff here is very nice, I don't want them to be get a negative review since Luxe properties did not fix a problem I assume was inherited when they bought this old Holiday Inn. When I went downstairs at 3am and asked for a room with no one on either side they gave me a new key immediately. So disappointed in this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than it was...but...”
Reviews.Author: rockstar89
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a Holiday Inn and besides being directly across the street from great locations like LA Live and Staples Center, it was a very old, run down hotel. Now, after being remodeled, it is VERY nice. I was super pleased with the new bedrooms and bathrooms. The only thing they did not do...sound proofing. You can hear everything and I mean EVERYTHING your neighbors do. Use the bathroom, talk, heck, maybe even chew gum. These are THIN walls. Luckily I stayed here 6 nights and only on the weekend did I have a problem. Iron Mike Tyson was my neighbor on the first night I checked in and I thought that was pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: jamindi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Luxe Downtown for 3 nights in early December on vacation. A lot of what we wanted to do (basketball game at Staples, concert at Nokia Live...) were literally right across the street. You can't beat the location - you definitely do not need a car if you will be staying in the downtown area for the duration of your stay, which is saying something in Los Angeles! We were a bit apprehensive upon check in - like many others here, we had not been informed that the pool, fitness center, restaurant, room service etc would not be available for the duration of our stay, which would have affected our choice of hotel considering we were on vacation and not business travelers. Also, the hotel is still clearly going through refurbishment - the lobby, elevators and hallways are still all sad looking. However, we were very happy with the room - very modern and clearly new. Bed was comfortable and spacious, the bathroom was well appointed (shower only, which did not bother us) and plenty closet space for a short trip. The room was cleaned regularly and well, but the cleaning staff was very loud - most mornings we woke up to their chatter in the hallway which was very annoying. Room also has free wi-fi which was great. We found front desk service to be fine when we needed a few items and a Federal Express package delivered. We did notice a discrepancy on our checkout for a mini fridge item that we did not use, but it was removed as soon as I pointed it out - just make sure you look at the bill carefully. Despite there being no room service or restaurant, we were fine with the restaurants in the area...you could walk to The Farm or the ESPN Sports Bar or several other places in 3 minutes or less, door to door. The biggest mar on our star thankfully happened during our early morning check out. As we were walking out of the lobby to our car we say them literally locking down the hotel - storm doors coming door, gates being locked...there was a big group of protesters lined up outside and they stared blaring horns and making a lot of noise. We had to be let out of a different entrance to the parking lot and the main one was blocked. Thankfully we were leaving right as it happened, but other guests must have had a rude awakening! They definitely still have a lot of kinks to work out, but would consider staying there again if we were able to get the same rate (of about $150 per room per night). Wouldn't pay more than that until they had all their amenities in place.

Reviews.Title: “WORST SERVICE EVER!”
Reviews.Author: hyunyoung
Reviews.Content: This is neither a luxury hotel or a business hotel. I travel frequently for business and although not all the hotels are luxury, they at least have the type of service required of hotels touting themselves as business hotels. The service on all levels was horrible from the cleaning service to the management, including: (1) Although I understand that there is no room service due to reservations, when I called Guest Services for recommendations of places that deliver they transferred me to the Front Desk, after being on hold for a good 3 minutes, the Front Desk gave me the number to "The Farm," assuring me that they deliver, they DO NOT DELIVER. When I called and asked them again, they couldn't give me the number to one restaurant/deli that delivered to the hotel; (2) When boxes I had shipped via FedEx arrived and I asked for them to be delivered to my room, I was told by the Front Desk that they would be right up. They never arrived. I had to call the Front Desk AGAIN several hours later, and ask AGAIN for them to be delivered. No one had any idea what I was talking about; (3) When I left my room, I saw the cleaning lady for my floor as I had been working in my room all day, I asked her to clean my room since I was leaving for a few hours and gave her the tip directly; my room was NOT CLEAN when I returned and apparently, the cleaning lady's shift had ended; (4) Finally, I gave them a box to FedEx back to my office on Saturday. I contacted and spoke twice with the Bell Desk who assured me that the box would be sent out on Saturday for Monday morning delivery. The box had the correct label on it, the only thing left to be done was to tape up the box and call FedEx. I have done this at half-a-dozen hotels in the last three months, with no issue. THE BOX WAS NOT HERE ON MONDAY and upon calling the hotel, some other bellman is telling me that the box was shipped out today per my instruction, which is complete BS. However, NO ONE AT FEDEX HAS ANY RECORD OF THE BOX BEING PICKED UP FROM THIS HOTEL ON MONDAY AND NO ONE CURRENTLY KNOWS WHERE THE BOX IS. MANAGEMENT WAS UNHELPFUL AT BEST, DISCOURTEOUS AS A RULE, AND TOOK NO RESPONSIBILITY FOR ITS STAFF. If the Luxe wants to salvage its reputation, the staff at this hotel needs a complete overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished room is lovely”
Reviews.Author: KateTraveler
Reviews.Content: So here's my qualifier -- I was in town for a conference so didn't use much of the hotel other than my room. The room was recently refurbished and it's really lovely! Really big room (room 711) with beautiful modern furniture and a super comfy bed. Nice bathroom with a great shower. I liked that there are several restaurants, movie theater, Grammy Museum right across the street. Rare to be in LA and not need to rent a car! The common areas need to be finished -- no restaurant or pool during the rehab. Should be good when it's all done; I'd definitely stay there again if I were attending stuff at Convention Center or Staples.

Reviews.Title: “Management fail.”
Reviews.Author: TacoMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February while it was still Holiday Inn -- somewhat dated, but decent, with very nice staff. We were back in town in October for an event at Staples Center. The Marriott was booked so we decided to reserve here. Learned that it had changed hands and was being renovated, but Website made no mention of several key issues: there was currently no pool, fitness center, bar, restaurant, room service, or food of any kind at the hotel--no vending machines; empty mini bars. Oh wait--a bowl of apples at the front desk. Granted, LA Live is across the street, and LA Bite will deliver, but still. Charging full-amenity prices ($260 per night) for a hotel with few amenities--not cool. Rooms had been nicely renovated and were pretty comfortable, other than a weird oversized painting of Madonna on the wall. We were relaxing in the room in our pjs after dinner when my daughter looked up and saw an enormous cockroach crawling along the crown moulding. She's a bug-phobe and I'm not, but this bug was scary even to me. Front desk sent a very nice maintenance man to help us change rooms, but when he tried to kill the roach he lost sight of it and it crawled up his arm, then flew right at my face -- creepy! My daughter wanted us to move to the Marriott, which now had rooms available, but it was late and seemed like a lot of hassle at the time. The room to which we were switched was pretty clean but obviously hadn't been used in a while-- It was dusty. The toilet seat was half-detached from the commode, which was a bit of a shock. When I called the front desk to have this fixed (very nice maintenance guy to the rescue again), I was told we would be given 50% off our stay to make up for our negative experiences. That seemed fair as we were staying two nights. My daughter still really wanted to switch hotels, but since they were adjusting the price I thought we should stay. Rest of the stay was okay, although it was hard to sleep thinking about huge cockroaches. Upon checkout, I found that we'd been discounted 50% off one night and charged full price for the second--not what I'd been told. Mentioned this to the clerk, who called the manager. Manager didn't bother to talk to me at all, just told the clerk to call the manager who'd been on duty our first night. This manager, who also didn't bother talking to me, said it was a "waterbug", not a cockroach, and we were only to get 50% off the one night. The clerk was polite and apologetic but said there was nothing she could do. Note to managers: One of your primary tasks is customer contact, especially when your guests have problems with their stay. Also, cockroaches are still cockroaches even when you call them waterbugs, and it is not good when they appear in guest areas of your establishment. I called Luxe's corporate offices after I got home and my bill was promptly adjusted to what I had been offered. Apparently the ownership change is still in progress, and even though Luxe's logo appears everywhere, it's not fully a Luxe property yet. My verdict: Don't stay here till the renovation's finished, and maybe not even then--unless they've replaced the current management.

Reviews.Title: “maid service very good - front desk service very poor”
Reviews.Author: kmhwins
Reviews.Content: i was expecting a holiday inn, then i was expecting city center hotel, upon my arrival it was the luxe city center hotel...the name changed often so i learn. the good stuff...the room was plush and comfortable. if you have business at the convention center or in town for an event at the nokia theatre or staples center its well within walking distance. upon my arrival i checked in and the front desk crew needs some help...i got my room keys and upon entering the room found someone was already in it; i got another room, but how embarrassing. they don't do a good job of telling you about the anemitieis. i still don't know if there's a pool, gym, business center or any kind of dining; not to mention awareness or instructions of wireless service. the contract you agree to lists a fee, but really there is no fee. they had a keurug coffee machine in the room with little to no stock to make a cup of coffee, but after leaving a note for the maid the restock was plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Sandra Machuca, Director of Sales is incredible!”
Reviews.Author: Zellin
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I had some difficulty with our reservation at a different hotel. (The previous owners, Holiday Inn.) Ms. Machuca found us a room in the property and honored all the arrangements we had made with the Holiday Inn. The property has been greatly improved since the Luxe took over and I look forward to staying at this convenient location again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are great - when completely renovated should be really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AshleyDCandBrussels
Reviews.Content: The location is good in terms of the Staples Center and/or the Convention Center, its also quite near the Red line Metro. Ralph's (grocery), Macy's and lots of great restaurants are also close by. Our room was fully renovated, it was great. Front desk staff was very helpful. While the renovation is ongoing guests are allowed to use the nearby Gold's Gym - which was excellent. If you need a hotel in this location - this is certainly one to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Don't try for luxury beginning with a former Holiday Inn...”
Reviews.Author: IntegrityTravel
Reviews.Content: Location’s great, but it’s a real life lesson in why not to try building a luxury hotel out of a former Holiday Inn. My company sentenced me to a four night stay at the hotel, and on the second to last night the hotel’s front desk staff claim the city’s DWP cut power to the building until what coworkers said was 2-4am. The hotel still had lights in the lobby and hallways, as well as a functioning elevator. Unfortunately they lacked any generator to power the guest rooms. I left for the night and went to a hotel across the street. At checkout it was a struggle trying to convince the hotel not to charge me for parking as I did not park my car at the hotel that night. Apparently they have no way to check their parking garage, and instead take your word for it. The staff, whether holdovers from the previous incarnation or not, seemed to still possess a Holiday Inn mentality. At check-in the front desk clerk got snippy with me when I requested additional room keys because of the hotel’s system that powers the guest room lights and air conditioner. I also found that I’d keep the key in the sensor to continue running electricity in the room, but the staff would apparently stop by rooms to remove the key and place it just above the sensor. So, I’d return and no lights would work and the room would be in the mid 70s -vs- the 60s I set it for. The bedding albeit nice, was dirty and appeared to have blood or other heavy stains soaked into them, that continue to be washed and cycled through guests. The 16x9 lcd screen was a waste, as they had no true HD programming available. So all the money spent on the new TV’s is only wasted on programming that is grainy, distorted and lacks the correct aspect ratio. Funny that for a hotel directly across the street from ESPN’s newest HD studio, the ESPN signal received at the hotel looks awful. The bathroom and shower were very modern and you could tell they were recently renovated. Though I found the sink to be awkward. The sink design is rooted more in style than function. The entire bathroom countertop becomes a pool in water that doesn’t make it to the sink. For something as simple as washing hands or brushing teeth. The sink’s faucet is even worse it’s tough to find the right temperature without defined controls. The shower design is modern and stylish and a departure from bath/shower combos. It features a selectable rain water, or handheld showerhead. The water pressure was weak, almost laughable. Internet was free, and at decent speeds, parking was $25 for self park (July 2010) in a garage littered with renovation construction materials. The hotel lacks a restaurant, bar and room service during the renovation (July 2010) but the location is great, because across the street is the LA Live outdoor mall with a half dozen restaurants. Two blocks east of the restaurant is the 24hr "Original Pantry," greasy spoon diner. If I had the choice I would not return, but instead would return to the JW Marriott or Ritz Carlton directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel except NO room service, restaurant or bar”
Reviews.Author: rcasey
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a great deal for the price in all respects...large, very clean, updated rooms, free internet, very close to convention center, friendly staff but BEWARE there is no room service, restaurant or bar at this time. When I checked in late last night there was a sign at the front desk saying that the restaurant and bar are closed b/c "undergoing renovations." I was planning to stay several nights for a conference but will now look for someplace else (Wilshire Grand?) b/c this is a deal killer for me as I don't want to have to go out for every meal.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Hotel, but Commendable Safety and Staff”
Reviews.Author: SML-Travels
Reviews.Content: The room was adequately sized, but not overly generous in square footage. However, it’s downtown Los Angeles. With the cost of real estate here, I’m not expecting a sprawling amount of space. I thought the décor was somewhat dated. The crown molding along the ceilings is a nice touch. However, I found the light-wood inserts on the dark-wood furniture to look more tacky than tasteful. Not a big deal, though. I find few business-class hotels with exciting décor. What bothered us the most was the complete lack of soundproofing. We could clearly hear conversations (both in Spanish and English) and normal “bumping around” noises from the adjoining rooms (and the one above us). Door-banging noises seemed much louder than average. Those were the noises inside the hotel. In terms of exterior noise, I expect to hear sirens and traffic noise in an urban setting, but it bothered my daughter’s sleep (and we faced away from Figueroa Blvd). The Holiday Inn has high-speed internet, but it is not wireless. That means you’re tethered to the one high-speed cord located on the desk (which is uncomfortably located too close to the HVAC unit, so you get a direct blast of hot or cold air). That also means only one person at a time can access the internet, which is a nuisance if there is more than one person in your group and they both want to use their laptops at the same time. Holiday Inn should update to wireless internet. I don’t know anyone anymore who actually uses a laptop at a desk. I want to prop it up on my lap and compute in bed. There was an electrical outlet on the side of one of our two beds to plug in a laptop cord; the person in the other bed was out of luck. I’m not a fan of window-based HVAC units because temperature is hard to regulate and they inevitably make me too hot or too cold. The Holiday Inn’s unit was no exception to this rule. It was noisy, too. I appreciated the little red light in the bathroom, so I could find my way there if need be in the middle of the night. It was helpful without being so bright that it intruded on my sleep. My over-50 eyes appreciated the fact that the shampoo bottles actually said ‘SHAMPOO’ in big black letters on a light background (I’ve encountered some hotels where it says something other than “shampoo” and it’s in small white letters on a light-colored bottle), so I appreciate not having to pull out my reading glasses to figure out which bottle to use. The Holiday Inn provides coupons good for up to $20 worth of breakfast at their restaurant on the second floor. I was easily able to feed one person for far less than the $20. Plus, breakfast hours were not limited to the early-morning hours as they usually are when a motel provides a free breakfast buffet. This met the approval of my late-rising teen. There is a ticket office and small gift shop tucked in the corner of the front lobby. They can provide tickets for a variety of events occurring throughout the Los Angeles area. Surprisingly, they had no knowledge of the movie schedule for the cinema across the street. The Hilton has made a commendable effort at security by requiring the use of your room’s key card to access the upper floors of the building by elevator. You slide your card in a slot in the elevator, and then it allows you to access your floor. And just YOUR floor. Experimentally, I tried entering floor numbers both higher and lower than my own. It wouldn’t let me do it. I realize that a second person could rush in behind the legitimate guest and exit on the same floor as the guest, but the Holiday Inn’s limited elevator access is more than the vast majority of hotels do to restrict access to the guest rooms. Since I own a home in Eureka (where there was recently a 6.5-magnitude earthquake), I couldn’t help wondering about the seismic safety of this 10-story hotel in the heart of Los Angeles. I asked at the front desk if the Holiday Inn had been retrofitted to meet modern earthquake seismic safety standards. The front desk clerks didn’t know. Overall, commendable safety and customer service. Holiday Inn, please install wireless internet and better soundproofing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: crumblina69
Reviews.Content: After the Laker game, my family was too tired to drive home so we booked a room here. The hotel seems outdated and needs some renovating. First, the hotel clerk gave us a room with a single bed. There were 4 of us, so we obviously weren't looking for a room that small. Once we went down to get another room, he told us we had to settle for a smoking room. The view was awful, but what can you expect on such short notice? I just feel that the rooms were way over priced. We got ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the location”
Reviews.Author: themonstersmom
Reviews.Content: My boys and I stayed at this hotel last weekend. We were going to a Lakers game and a Kings hockey game. The location for the Staples Center or Nokia Center is perfect! Literally across the street, only about 1/4 of a block to the stop light to cross the street and you are there. The hotel itself is quite average, nothing fancy, you do pay a much higher price for the room than other places but you are paying for the location. The rooms were very average, need updating. The carpets were stained and the beds weren't anything special. We had an amazing view of the Staples Center and my boys loved that. The noise level is high, with all the action going on outside until late. We did not eat at the hotel, it was just a short walk to IHOP so we opted for that. The business center was fine, 2 computers available and we never had to wait. We used the valet parking option, the cost to park is $25 a day whether you valet or self park. That rate is not bad but added to the higher room rates it does add up. The staff was very nice, no problems there. We were disappointed that they didn't really have any sort of gift shop. They do have a ticket broker and in that space they sell a few larger priced jerseys etc. Since it was pouring down rain the entire weekend we did not use or even see the pool. Is this the nicest hotel we have stayed in, not even close. Is is great if you are attending events at the Staples Center, you bet. Would I stay here otherwise, not at all. In my opinion this place is way overpriced for what you get and needs to be updated but you can't beat the location and that is what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “our stay in los angeles”
Reviews.Author: terrymim
Reviews.Content: our stay was further enhanced by the the staff and the facilities thye staff couldn't do enough for us

Reviews.Title: “needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: KAPE9
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located in LA. Walking distance from LA Convention Center and Staples Center. Only problem is that it is very old. Carpet smells old. Furnitures are also old. Needs major renovation! But the service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: FES
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights while in LA for a conference at the Los Angeles Convention Center which is a five minute walk from the hotel. There’s a number of restaurants within a block and the Staples Center is across the street. The staff was very friendly. The property is basic Holiday Inn and shows quite a bit of wear. This is the only hotel I’ve been in that requires you to use your room keycard to operate the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, and few complaints”
Reviews.Author: griffeymac
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn in downtown L.A. to attend the Adobe MAX conference that was held at the convention center. The Holiday Inn was one of the "suggested" conference hotels and while the block of rooms reserved for the conference was booked, I was still able to make a reservation as a "normal person" and the price was comparable. The hotel itself was quite clean. My room was clean. It wasn't the fanciest place in the world, but it wasn't dirty, it wasn't dated, and I thought it was just fine for the money. The bed was comfortable, the television had plenty of stations, and the wired Internet worked great (at no additional cost--who still charges for Internet access in a hotel?). The only complaint I'd have is that apparently the day before I arrived one of the elevators broke and was out of service the entire duration of my stay. Really? I could understand if an elevator at a hotel in Tuscola, Illinois broke and it took a few days to get someone to come out and take a look, but in downtown Los Angeles you couldn't have had someone show up within a few hours? Not that big of a deal until later in the week when a group of elderly people for some sort of a reunion showed up and there was a wait to use the elevator (it would have been nice to have usable stairs that were not just for fire exit-only). The bar was nice and clean and the bartender was friendly. Drinks were expensive, but so was everything else I experienced in L.A. that week. The second-floor beer garden overlooking L.A. Live, the ESPN Zone, and Figueroa Avenue was pretty cool. I'd definitely recommend this hotel and I would stay there again. It was clean, and the staff was quite friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “nice city night sceneries and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: wolfcookies101
Reviews.Content: I came here for the Anime Expo convention in the Staples Center and this hotel was the nicest and closest hotel around for this event. Also, it is literally across the street from where the Michael Jackson memorial service was and there are some great restaurants in the plaza such as WolfGang Puck's and there is even a midnight bowling ally! The rooms were nice and cozy and everything was set by the time we got there. When we requested a roll-away bed, it was there by the time we made it to our room! The walls are kind of thin so you can hear hallway conversations and some T.V. in the next room but that's only if your room is completely quiet and it's not extremely annoying. The parking is guaranteed for all people rooming here and you can always count on a parking space no matter how late you come back. The pool is a little skimpy and not very big at all but it's outdoors and has a nice scenery of the city and so does the rooms themselves. One thing that was bad was no free breakfast or pastries in the morning and you have to pay for only one entreé instead of being able to pay for a nice breakfast buffett. Other than that, it was nice, cozy, and clean!

Reviews.Title: “functional option nearest the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: compassjohn
Reviews.Content: Stay here if proximity is important. Staff was good but go outside for food or a bar

Reviews.Title: “A terrible disappointment”
Reviews.Author: GuyInTheSkies
Reviews.Content: I had an absolutely terrible experience at this establishment. The customer service was very sub-par and the facility felt more like a hostel than a $250/night hotel. The parking attendants were so rude, and embarrassed me in front of my business client (barking "25$! $25! as soon as she exited her vehicle at the valet." I could have overlooked one or two things, but the whole experience was dismal, from start to finish. There are too many great hotels in L.A. to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Came for American Idol finale - great location - right across street from Nokia Theater!! Definitely served our purpose!”
Reviews.Author: PinkGirl66
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were in town for the American Idol finale staying just one night at this hotel - on May 20, 2009 and found it to be a great place to stay. Very convenient to the Nokia Theater and Staples Center. I'd definitely come back if I needed a hotel in the downtown LA area. It was a little tricky to originally get to the hotel due to one way streets - our GPS was taking us in circles to get there! They offer valet parking for the same price if you park yourself which was nice. We went to check in around noon and our room wasn't ready yet. Came back an hour or so later after we ate lunch and our room still wasn't ready. The woman that helped us wasn't as helpful as the guy - wish I remember his name! - he offered to look up our room and get us in another room on the other side of the hotel. It didn't have a refrigerator or microwave (which didn't matter to us anyway) and was $20 cheaper! Fine by us! He got us right into our new room and we made it over to watch the red carpet across the street with time to spare to get a good spot! My only comment would be that there's no free breakfast buffet - you have to eat at the hotel restaurant and order breakfast off of the regular menu. Overall, this hotel was nice - very basic - no frills - but was clean and served our purpose. I'd come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: LoveMayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of its great location across from the Nokia theater. The room was great! It had a neat view of the complex right across the street. It is close to many restaurants, The Staples Center, Nokia theater, and Club Nokia. There are tours that you can take right from the hotel. Everyone that we excountered there, including bellmen, front desk, and even waiters at the restaurant were very friendly and helpful. They have a business center with internet access that we were able to use also. The restaurant upstairs is good. Very reasonably priced. There are cheaper hotels in the area, but if you are attending an event at the Staples Center or Nokia theater there isn't a better located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Lakers”
Reviews.Author: jimmyb01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Jan 2nd for a Lakers game at the Staples Center. The Center is 1 min walk away which is fantastic to avoid the crowds. It has a nice pool and a nice bar. It is located in an area with nice shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: mr88oh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located in downtown L.A. It's not too far from LAX (an easy drive), and one block from Staples Center. The front desk personnel didn't impress me, but they were OK. They weren't able to answer some easy questions, though. The decor of the hallways is 1960's scary. But my room was nicely redone. I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant, and it was excellent. My room was 726, which was located in the back of the hotel and was quiet. A very nice (and expensive) restaurant, The Palm, is about two blocks away. It's possible to walk, safely, to the USC campus from this hotel (it's about a 15 minute walk). The bus stop is an easy two blocks away. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maidAlberta
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel in early december, when we attended events at the staples center. THIS LOCATION IS THE BEST. We were able to walk to the staples center, which is across the street. You do not have to deal with the traffic after the event or the parking issues. The hotel rooms have plenty of space, and were kept very clean. Because of the area there is some outside noise.

Reviews.Title: “3 star with 5 star location”
Reviews.Author: Travelbeat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within easy walking distance to the LA Convention Center, Staple Center (hockey, basketball) Nokia for concerts. Also the downtown area. Nearby lots of restaurants like Mortons, Palm and Roy's and many many more. The hotel shows a bit of age but not enough that you should be totally put off. It is not a hotel for a romantic weekend in LA but is perfect for being at the convention center for an expo.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the convention center”
Reviews.Author: around_the_world_nj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fabulous location if you're attending a conference or a basketball game. But I wouldn't stay too long. The staff was very nice - especially when I arrived, the agent gave me great information about the surrounding area and restaurants/shopping. But the rooms were run down and not as clean as I would've expected - especially for the $ they charge. I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: elmcity
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn for one night. I was greeted rather curtly by the staff downstairs - a surly young woman handed me the keys and sent me on my way. I went to the room and saw a "do not disturb" sign on the door. I swiped the key nonetheless, and opened it to find a room that was trashed - there was tinsel all over, the bed was unmade, and there were liquor bottles on the floor. Horrified, I went back downstairs to that surly woman and told her that she sent me to an occupied room. Her response? "Oh!" Without so much as an apology, she assigned me to another room. This one was thankfully unoccupied, but I found it to be unclean and uncomfortable: the carpet was dirty, the bed cover stained and there was a hair on the bathtub. The bed and pillows were extremely uncomfortable. I know Holiday Inns are not luxury resorts, but I at least expected to be greeted professionally and to have a room that was clean. I will not be staying there or at any other Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Alternative to Pricey Downtown Hotels”
Reviews.Author: markmywordz
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although styled in the 70s style old large Holiday Inns has been updated so that it is much nicer and while not quite on par with the more expensive fancy downtown LA hotels, it is a great alternative for those looking to save some money over the higher prices and for those who are going either to the Staples Center or the LA Convention Center. It is EXTREMELY convenient from both of those and no need for a taxi or shuttle. They are within a one to two block walk. The rooms are large, the beds are moderately comfy. The carpet could use some replacing. It is showing signs of wear. The bathrooms are big with a good shower. (My sink drain stopper didn't work but that was no big deal). There is a small rooftop pool over the 2nd floor. It is a small outdoor pool so not really useful for anything other than small kids. It has a fairly good restaurant with booths that have individual TVs at each booth for solo travellers to stay entertained while waiting for your food. It is very convenient to the LA Metro trains. From LAX don't bother with a $60 cab ride. You can take the Metro Green Line to the Blue Line for $1.25 each way. Just catch the connector bus to the train station and grab the Metro. Or for only $4 one way, you can take the LA Flyaway Bus to Union Station and take the Red LIne to the 7th Street transit station and walk three blocks to get there. Overall, I was skeptical at first but once I got there I found it was a very good deal for a good location and very convenient to certain downtown LA spots. One quick note: there is a major expansion of the convention center complex happening right across the street and some of the activity happens early in the morning with construction trucks making lots of noise. It will only be until probably late Sept. 08. But if you ask, the front desk will put you on the back side of the hotel and it won't nearly be as noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, great! Service... could have been better”
Reviews.Author: mholloran
Reviews.Content: The Good: This is a great location. You're right downtown, just walking distance from the Fashion District and what not.
