Sure, there is construction going on, and some sidewalks are closed, but that was no big deal for us as we are from NYC. Clean rooms, cute decorating. Free internet, spacious rooms. I felt very safe in the hotel; security was top notch. The Bad: We were a little confused on how to get here. The street starts out as a two way street, then changes to one way right in front of the hotel, so that threw us for a loop (or two) a few times. There is a new building being constructed across the street, but the view should be better once it's complete. Staples Center is near, which can be good if you're attending something there, but we did not realize that a championship game between the Lakers and Spurs was going on the first night of our stay, so it was kind of packed in the lobby and bar, but we probably should have researched that. The Ugly: Paper thin walls. So, at just after midnight, there are kids screaming and running up and down the halls. The headboard of the bed next door (or maybe it was from upstairs) banged against our wall for about ten minutes. The customer service is terrible. We've called the front desk several times and rarely get an answer. Going to a Dodgers game, we asked the attendant to hail us a cab. What pulled up was a REALLY nice luxury sedan. The attendant said this to us: "Oh, here is our hotel's courtesy taxi. Enjoy your game!" Now, there were three of us, and we all heard that. So, we get dropped off at the farthest place possible at the stadium, and as we get out of the car, the driver tells us that its a $30 charge. So much for a courtesy taxi. Game was awesome, we call back to the hotel just shy of 9pm, asking for their "courtesy" taxi to come pick us up. She tells us that they have no courtesy taxis, just a taxi company they have a contract with and "every employee here KNOWS that." Then she says that all of the drivers have gone home for the day, so we should just call another taxi company. Then click. Didn't offer to call a company for us, much less give us the numbers to one. So its raining outside, and we found a cab parked MUCH closer to the stadium, and it was only $11 from the stadium to the hotel. This was even after we were stuck in traffic for a while. Bar closes at 10pm. Oh, and they don't have a free shuttle to and from the airport. Next trip to LA, we'll be looking for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Writer101
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a good location. Right across from Staples center and near Metro. Friendly staff and great service. Clean, nice, HUGE room.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: WestcoastguyYVR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very average. Location is pretty good. The hotel is clean. The bed isn't all that comfortable. I prefer to have thicker blankets, more fluffy. But it is okay. The hotel restaurant food is okay. Not great selection. Service isn't consistent. Front desk staff was helpful. Nothing exceptionally good about this hotel. Nothing that bad. Good for business. Wired internet, not wireless, so that might be inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Beachkidboy
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel experience. I stay here whenever I'm attending anything at the Convention Center, Staples or the Nokia. It's directly across the street. Saves driving time and parking hassles at the venues. You can get there in the afternoon, relax, attend your event and walk back for the night and avoid parking lot jams. On-site lounge/bar and restaurant for convienence. Sure Staples has these features but it's a madhouse of people. I was here for Van Halen, as much of the hotel guests were too. Will be back four more times at least, into May 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: uklad79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as we were traveling around a few places in California and wanted to go to a Lakers game. The hotel is across the road from the Staples Center which was very handy and is a good base to discover downtown LA by foot. The hotel has a small pool which wasn't well heated for swimming in November. There is a business room with internet access and priner for free which came in handy. The rooms and hallways are nicely decorated and are kept clean. We were on the top floor at the end of the hallway near the fire eascpe. This is not the best place to be as you can hear people on mobile phones in teh fire escape as the walls are not all that thick. Other than that this hotel is in the best location if you want to see downtown or see a Lakers game and was a great deal for us as we used Prioity Club points, the room rates online seemed good at the weekedn which is when we visited. The subway stops close by if you are coming from Union Station or Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Good for location and price”
Reviews.Author: Tokyofirsttimer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn City Center for two nights in late July. The location near the Staples/Convention Center couldn't be better if that's what you need. We are fond of walking and had no problems getting downtown on foot at different times of day and night--not at all threatening. I wouldn't have wandered the area alone in the evening, but that's the same for a woman by herself in just about any urban location. We reserved through Priority Club and got a reasonably sized room on the back side of the building. It was extremely clean and comfortable. Furnishings were new, and it looked like the bathroom had been redone fairly recently. The overall feel of the room was not eye-poppingly luxurious, but definitely better than average. And either we lucked out and there was no one staying on either side of us for two nights or the room was particularly well built because we never heard other people's noise. We had drinks at the bar one night, and breakfast one morning. The food was fine, and service was friendly. My biggest complaint is that there were TVs plastered all over both spaces--acceptable, I guess, for a bar near the Staples Center, but definitely overkill in the dining area. Front desk staff were helpful and the overnight parking charge was less than many other downtown hotels, and you could get your car yourself. Overall, I would have no problem recommending this hotel if you are looking for something clean, comfortable, and reasonably priced in the Staples Center area. Although not an "experience" hotel, it was just fine as a base for our LA activities.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not good”
Reviews.Author: c3pon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the closest to the LA convention center. The room are extremely small and the walls are paper thin...all we did was listen to crying kids all night in the room next door! The room was clean and well stocked. Nice decor

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: docrick
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights i got a deal as last minute. com were doing a cheaper price than their website i spoke to them and according to their policy, knocked 10% the cheapest i could get, so paid only 100$ a night for a king its in the financial district, so not many things to do, but walk to the metro stop and you could be on the walk of fame in 30 mins for 5$ there is a direct metro to the universal studios decent room, restaurant is better than expected free internet, they provide the cord as well become a prority club member, free newsapper ,bottle of water everyday and 10% off the restuarant bill would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel in a Good Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: Catsfan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Holiday Inn City Center with my wife for four nights in March.We were attending two events in the Staples Center and found the location perfect.The Hotel is also very close to Downtown and has plenty of public transport closeby.The area is very clean and safe contrary to what other posters said about the neighbourhood.I would recommend this Hotel as a good place to base yourself for a vacation in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Location is its best feature”
Reviews.Author: 44Boppa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights here in January '07 while on a group tour. We had booked a room with a king bed when we made our reservation three months ahead. But they gave us a room with two singles, saying they were totally sold out. The next day they were able to move us while we were out, and that was a plus. The hotel and rooms were just a little bit tired, though acceptable. Our tour group was supposed to have breakfast prepared for us in a private room each morning, but on our second morning in the place there was no breakfast, no staff, nothing to take care of this. The hotel gave us vouchers for the American breakfast in their dining room, and that made up for it. Overall, it wasn't a bad experience, and the staff did its best to be helpful. However, I would probably try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Let The Bed Bugs Bite”
Reviews.Author: Strumny
Reviews.Content: Disgusting customer service and dirty room.

Reviews.Title: “Good for conventions”
Reviews.Author: Mowgus
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I attended a conference and it was very convenient for that. The Staples Center and Convention Center is a short walk away (but don't do it late at night alone). The hotel is very clean and of average size. It has a pool but it's on the street side so we never used it. There isn't much around this hotel for shopping, food, etc. If you take a cab anywhere expect it to be $40. $40 to Universal Studios, $40 to LAX, $40 to Santa Monica Pier...you get the idea. If you're going to or coming from LAX take the Super Shuttle. It's $15 one way so you can save some $$. You might want to stay a little further north if you plan to eat out. Stay here if you're just going to the convention center and don't plan to socialize.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: NoTellin
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters to convention goers/business people. It is not kid friendly. They charge for everything. There's no microwave or refrigerator in the room unless you pay for it. The parking is $15 per day, and this is not a safe location, so you cannot really park anywhere else. The parking lot attendant was quite pleasant. The closet space was minimal. The windows were dirty. The tub was actually dirty as well, and had long black hair in it. We waited at least 45 minutes for two hamburgers in the hotel restaurant. The restaurant service was below average in general. The pool is right next to the bar, on display, and there zero shade. It's also tiny. The hotel is not in a safe location. During the short time that we left the hotel and drove a few blocks away, there was a shooting, police, and helicopters. Around the corner there was a protest and a block was shut off to cars. It took about 30 minutes to drive around a 4 block radius. I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffsbouge
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed for 4 nights in late July. Our room was very clean, the staff friendly, all spoke great English! Overall, we would definitely stay again and recommend this hotel to our friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Staples Center events!”
Reviews.Author: VivaLasVegas06
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I'm surprised at the bad reviews. Keep in mind - this is a HOLIDAY INN hotel and not the RITZ. However, it did exceed my expectations. The customer service was outstanding! The front desk personnell even arranged a taxi for our trip back to the airport which saved us the headache. The restaurant in the hotel had GREAT food!! We were only in LA for 2 days for an event at Staples Center and the hotel was right across the street. The rooms were immaculate and they have Herbal Essences shampoo (for those that care!) I'd definitely recommend this hotel! In my opinion, if you are looking for a cheap and nice hotel for an event at Staples Center this is a great choice for location and price. Tip: if you reserve your room online (on the Holiday Inn website), you can get the AAA rate which is only $119 compared to $140 a night. We do have an AAA card, but were never asked to show it at the front desk. A side note: the taxi ride we took from Holiday Inn to LAX was in a Lincoln Navigator and the cost was $45 plus tip. We took the "super shuttle" from LAX to Holiday Inn for $15 each ($30 total plus tip) and honestly I wasn't impressed. They make 2 trips around the airport and pack in as many people as possible in the van. We were crushed in there like sardines and then had to wait for lots of other stops to be made before we got to our destination. For the price, I can't complain much but I'd much rather spend the extra $15 and ride in comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: threed82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hottel because of it's proximity to the Staples Center, which by the way couldn't have been better. A few complaints, the $20 breakfast vouchers you buy don't get you that far in their "Denny's style" restaurant, especially with a family of four. Also, one of the two elevators was broken and we probably spent 5-10 mins just waiting for the one elevator to pick us up at any given time. The room was decent, lots of space and semi-comfortable beds. Bathroom was clean and spacious. Parking was an additional $15 p/day but I suppose that's typical for downtown. Not bad overall.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have come to LA every year for the x-games and we stay at the Holiday Inn. The staff is excellent, great service and they treat the guests like loyalty....love it and Tommy is great!!! We will be coming again in August 2005.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: shepdec
Reviews.Content: I work in the Trade Show and Convention Business, and have worked on shows at the Los Angeles Convention Center for more than twenty-five years. I've never stayed in an area hotel, since the center is only about thirty minutes from my home. This time, my client offered me a complimentary room at the Holiday Inn. I gratefully accepted it, thinking that it might come in handy between the late nights and early mornings. I had no intention of staying the entire seven nights, guessing that I would go home some nights. I changed my mind. The hotel pleasantly surprised me. I called the front desk before leaving home to see if they could handle an early check in. The clerk was polite, and told me to come right over and ask for Elizabeth. When I arrived she had me set up with a VIP room on the top floor. The passenger elevators require a room key to get past the restaurant on the second floor for security. My room was clean and well appointed. I'm not sure what the difference is between rooms on the top floor and others. But, this room had two queen beds, and a work desk with a free high-speed Internet hookup for my laptop that was hassle free. The room service menu had everything that was available at the restaurant on the second floor. It featured a huge number of choices, and everything I ate, I enjoyed. They also have a large desert menu. A few of the nights I ate at the hotel bar, located next to the restaurant. They had several TV's including a huge wide screen showing current sporting events. The bar tenders were polite and attentive, and would take food orders at the bar. The pool was also at this level, but it was too cold to swim, though I stuck my hand in it and it was heated. The decor was dated, especially in the hallways. It looked like it had not been changed since the 60's. But, it was clean. I ended up spending all seven nights at the hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff here is very friendly - needed a ride to the airport and forgot to schedule it the day before but the staff member there (I think the name is Adam) was real nice and booked my shuttle. The room is really big and they also provide you with two complementary water bottles - which I have never seen anywhere else. You can hold your luggage in the hotel free of charge while you are out doing something else. The bar and restaurant are also very nice - the meal I had the restaurant was delicious (tomato ravioli something). The hotel is across an intersection from the Staples Center, so you can see people going to the Staples Center from the lobby. Would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fraudulent Charges!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This would have been a decent stay for Los Angeles, but the error in charges and the handling of it by the hotel made the stay sour!

Reviews.Title: “Comedy of errors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based largely on the stellar recommendations at tripadvisor (and the hotel's close proximity to USC). What a mistake. There was only one working elevator, and it was remarkably slow. (Plus, it's a huge pain in the neck to scan your room card and select your floor once you're in the elevator.) The rooms are large, which is the hotel's one redeeming quality, but the front desk staff is strangely impersonal and ineffective. We called for a bellhop only to have our request ignored. On sunday am, we awoke to discover the streets outside the hotel were closed for the LA marathon. We were given no advance notice by the hotel, and when we attempted to return to the hotel later that morning, we were forced to pay to park in a lot three blocks away. The front desk staff refunded the hotel's parking fee for the nite ($15), but offered no apology for the inconvenience. The breakfast is overpriced and the exercise room is small. Do yourself a favor and find a holiday inn express nearby. You may think you're saving time by staying close to USC and Staples Center here, but you're really just asking for frustration.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service,clean,safe and close to shopping.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service from the time I walked in to the time I left was excellent. Friendly and helpful gentelman at the door and very professional and friendly employees when I checked in, to the nice lady who cleaned the room. I have stayed in different hotels from California to New york and overseas. It is sad to see how employees can be rude and cold when you check in. Not at the Holiday Inn City Center downtown Los Angeles. This was not only my experience. I also noticed how well they treated others while waiting. The hotel is very clean, close to shopping and very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have stayed at in years! Right across from the Staples Center and Convention cennter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn- City Center has the nicest Lobby, Bar and Rooms of any hotel that I have stayed at in some time. (Yes, a Holiday Inn believe it or not!) This hotel is outfited with nice hardwood crown moldings and chair rail. It has a well priced restaurnant and a menu that you would never expect at a Holiday Inn. I have heard they hired a chef from a five star hotel to re-create the restaurant and bar. The rooms are the biggest rooms in LA, with granite bathrooms, everything was very nice and new. The staff is very helpful and friendly.This is an amazing experience if you need to go to Downtown LA and don't want to spend $170 a night you will get a nicer room, better food, great service and a steal at around $109 a night.
